Box 825 Anadarko, OK 73005 Location 31064 State Highway #281 Building 100 Anadarko, OK 73005 Phone: 405.247.2448 Fax: 405.247.9393, 7299=1878-80: the band was under the jurisdiction of the Kiowa Agency, 21942=Weslager, C.A., The Delaware Indians: A History, Rutgers University Press (1972), hardcover, 546 pages, WorldCat 282073, 7212=1859-78: The band was under the jurisdiction of the Wichita Agency, 12218=Pre-1880 Correspondence, 7127=1847-59: The band was under the jurisdiction of the Texas Agency, 14441=In 1936, the Oklahoma Historical Society and University of Oklahoma requested a writer's project grant from the Works Progress Administration (WPA) in which interviews would be conducted with early settlers in Oklahoma who had lived on Indian land. More than 100 writers conducted over 11,000 interviews and were asked to "call upon early settlers and (record) the story of the migration to Oklahoma and their early life here." [1] The University of Oklahoma Western History Collection has digitized the Indian Pioneer Papers which consists of approximately 80,000 indexed entries arranged alphabetically by personal name, place name, or subject. [2] An index to the Indian Pioneer Papers may also be found at OkGenWeb Oklahoma Genealogy. A separate index of Indians interviewed, including the Delaware, may be viewed at: “Indians in the Indian Pioneer Papers” Two surnames from the Delaware tribe found in the collection are: Ketchum and Zeigler (Ketchum).}
textBeforeTable: Correspondence and Census Records Southern Superintendency Central Superintendency St. Louis Superintendency Michigan Superintendency Superintendencies authorized by the the Bureau of Indian Affairs supervised the local agencies and subagencies.  Superintendencies There are hundreds of Indian Reservations in the United States. Many are federally recognized and supervised.  Some are state reservations, administered by the state office of Indian Affairs. Reservations are tracks of land established by treaty or law for the American Indians to occupy and use. Reservations Kiowa Agency Wichita Agency Texas Agency Red River Agency Caddo Agency Union Agency Cherokee Agency Delaware Agency Kansas Agency Fort Leavenworth Agency Ohio Agency Piqua Agency Agencies are the
textAfterTable: 1862 Census of Delaware Indians FHL Film: 989204 Census rolls various years, Delaware Indians holding citizenship in the Cherokee Nation. FHL film: 989204 Indian Pioneer Papers In 1936, the Oklahoma Historical Society and University of Oklahoma requested a writer's project grant from the Works Progress Administration (WPA) in which interviews would be conducted with early settlers in Oklahoma who had lived on Indian land. More than 100 writers conducted over 11,000 interviews and were asked to "call upon early settlers and (record) the story of the migration to Oklahoma and their early life here." [1] The University of Oklahoma Western History Collection has digitized the Indian Pioneer Papers which consists of approximately 80,000 indexed entries arranged alphabetically by personal name, place name, or subject. [2] An index to the Indian Pioneer Papers may also be found at OkGenWeb Oklahoma Genealogy. A separate index of Indians interviewed, including the Delaware, may be viewed at: “Indians in the Indian Pioneer Papers” Two surnames from the Delaware tribe found in the collection are: Ketchum and Zeigler (Ketchum). References ↑ Blackburn, Bob L. "Battle Cry for History: The First Century of the Oklahoma Historical Society." n.d. Oklahoma Historical Society. 5 Oct. 1998. ↑ The
